UnicodeUTF-16 formatcompatibility notescompatibilitynotes regarding UnicodeBeginning with Version 2.7.2 uses the Unicode UTF-16 format to store its internal data files, such as segmented documents, Translation Memories, dictionaries, terms lists, and others. This is transparent to the user. All functions work without visible changes, and most conversions, required when dealing with data from previous versions, are performed quietly and automatically. Nevertheless, you should take notice about the following when starting to use Version 2.7.2 or higher:
Version 2.7.2 is upward compatible with previous versions. It can process objects from previous versions, and automatically converts them if required. Once objects are converted or generated by Version 2.7.2 or higher, they cannot be processed by earlier versions.
If you share certain resources, such as dictionaries or Translation Memories, with other users, all users must have Version 2.7.2 or higher installed. Users of earlier versions cannot share a UTF-16 based resource.compatibilityshared resourcesshared resourcescompatibility notes
Exported folders from earlier versions can be imported by Version 2.7.2 or higher. If required, conversions are performed automatically. However, exported folders from Version 2.7.2 or higher cannot be imported by earlier versions.

The new entry point names got the letter W appended.
The old entry points are still supported and can be used without modification. Input data to and output data from these entry points is automatically converted to UTF-16 format. However, it is recommended that the new entry points are used to avoid this conversion.
Note also that segmented data is stored internally in UTF-16 format. User exits that directly access this data need to be recoded.
In the Translation Environment you might notice that characters from different code pages can be simultaneously displayed. 's STANDARD editor and RTFEdit editor both support documents in UTF-16 format.
